item.title: 比特币 "减半 "将给加密货币矿工带来 100 亿美元的损失
item.description: 对于比特币爱好者来说，每四年一次的软件更新 "减半 "一直被认为是支撑比特币价值的关键之一。【原文：For enthusiasts of Bitcoin, a once-every-four-years software update called the “halving” has long been held as one of the keys to propping up its value.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后市场权衡报复周期风险
item.description: 在新的一周里，金融市场将为地缘政治而焦虑不安，主要取决于伊朗周末对以色列史无前例的打击是否会引发一轮又一轮的报复。【原文：Financial markets will face the new week fretting about geopolitics with much riding on whether Iran’s unprecedented weekend strike on Israel triggers rounds of retaliation.】

item.title: 美元碾压同侪，新兴市场与弱势货币抗争
item.description: 在新兴市场，尤其是亚洲，货币干预已成为一个关键战场，因为美元最近的上涨给官员们施加了采取行动的压力。【原文：Currency intervention has become a key battleground in emerging markets, especially Asia, as the latest leg up in the dollar piles pressure on officials to act.】

item.title: 中国将维持关键利率和流动性稳定以巩固经济复苏
item.description: 本周，当一笔政策性贷款到期时，中国可能会维持关键利率不变，并提供充裕的流动性，以维持宽松的条件，帮助经济复苏和增加债务销售。【原文：China may hold a key interest rate and make liquidity abundant this week when a policy loan matures, maintaining accommodative conditions to aid a patchy economic recovery and increased debt sales.】

item.title: 莫迪政党在竞选宣言中誓言增长与发展
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）将在本周的投票中争取历史性的第三次连任，印度执政党在竞选宣言中承诺将重点发展基础设施建设，并继续提供大众补贴。【原文：India’s ruling party pledged to focus on infrastructure and keep popular subsidies in place in its election manifesto as Prime Minister Narendra Modi bids for a historic third term in voting this week.】

item.title: 用途最广的食用油的未来可能在拉丁美洲
item.description: 世界正面临着用途最广的食用油日益短缺的问题。解决之道可能在于距离东南亚大片棕榈油种植园半个地球之外的新兴生产商。【原文：The world is facing a growing shortage of its most versatile edible oil. The solution may lie with emerging producers half a world away from Southeast Asia’s vast palm oil plantations.】

item.title: 肖尔茨前往中国执行缓和贸易紧张局势的任务
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨本周将向中国传达一个微妙的信息：中国政府尚未对欧洲提出的结束歧视性商业行为的警告采取行动，否则将导致紧张局势升级。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will be taking a delicate message to China this week: Beijing has not acted on European warnings to end discriminatory business practices and failure to do so will result in an escalation in tensions.】

item.title: 比特币因伊朗袭击事件创 2023 年以来最大跌幅后趋于平稳
item.description: 由于中东地缘政治紧张局势升级刺激了避险情绪，加密货币市场出现更广泛的暴跌，比特币在创下一年多来最大跌幅后企稳。【原文：Bitcoin steadied after sinking the most in more than a year, part of a wider tumble in cryptocurrency markets as escalating geopolitical tension in the Middle East spurred risk aversion.】

item.title: 世界经济大逃亡并不能让 20 国集团感到欣慰
item.description: 如果全球经济正在软着陆，那么一路上可能会有很多焦虑。【原文：If the global economy is heading for a soft landing, there’s likely to be plenty of anxiety along the way.】

item.title: 科技公司资金紧张，债权人相互 "暴力 "相向
item.description: 七巨头的无情崛起让人们很容易忘记，许多科技公司无利可图，债务负担沉重。现在，该领域的债权人为了获得偿付，开始反目成仇。【原文：The relentless rise of the Magnificent Seven makes it easy to forget that many tech firms are unprofitable and struggling with their debt burdens. Now, creditors in the space are turning against one another in a bid to get repaid.】

item.title: 维勒罗伊-德-加尔豪称欧洲央行将于 6 月降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲中央银行可能在 6 月份降息。【原文：The European Central Bank is likely to cut interest rates in June, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 乌克兰债券持有人选择 PJT 和 Weil 作为重组顾问
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在可能的重组之前，一群乌克兰债务持有人已选择 PJT Partners Inc 作为其财务顾问。【原文：A group of Ukrainian debt holders has chosen PJT Partners Inc as its financial adviser ahead of a potential restructuring, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 伦敦金属交易所禁止新的俄罗斯金属，但为旧货泛滥做好准备
item.description: 在美国和英国实施制裁后，伦敦金属交易所禁止交割新的俄罗斯金属，但却为一波旧货流入市场敞开了大门，增加了定价混乱的风险。【原文：The London Metal Exchange banned delivery of new Russian metal following sanctions imposed by the US and UK, but left the door open for a wave of old stocks to hit the market and raise the risk of pricing dislocations.】

item.title: 尽管大跌 45 亿美元，特朗普仍有望在 SPAC 获得额外收益
item.description: 特朗普传媒与科技集团股份有限公司（Trump Media & Technology Group Corp.但是，要想让前总统及其公司内部人士的巨额特别奖金面临风险，它必须损失更多。【原文：A rocky start for Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. shares has wiped out $4.5 billion in market value in just a couple of weeks. But it will have to lose a lot more than that to put at risk the massive special bonus due to the former president and his corporate insiders.】

item.title: 80 亿美元的生命线让美国玉米带熠熠生辉
item.description:
拟议中的碳管道的领导者称，该管道将促进对谷物的需求，并为中西部创造数千个工作岗位。那么，为什么一些农民如此反对呢？【原文：

Leaders of a proposed carbon pipeline say it will boost demand for the grain and create thousands of Midwest jobs. So why are some farmers so opposed?

】

item.title: 世界各地的工厂正缓慢地重新运转起来
item.description: 世界各地的装配线又开始嗡嗡作响，标志着长达数年的制造业低迷出现了转机。【原文：Assembly lines around the world are starting to hum again, marking a turn in a years-long manufacturing slump.】

item.title: 加纳就国际货币基金组织的 3.6 亿美元资金达成员工级别协议
item.description: 加纳与国际货币基金组织的工作人员达成了一项协议，使其更接近于在 6 月份之前获得约 3.6 亿美元的融资。【原文：Ghana reached an agreement with International Monetary Fund staff that puts it closer to accessing about $360 million in financing by June.】

item.title: 中国最高立法者在金正恩会晤中重申与朝鲜的关系
item.description: 中国最高立法委员周六会见了朝鲜领导人金正恩，这凸显了中国政府深化与平壤合作的努力。【原文：China’s top legislator met North Korea’s leader Kim Jong Un on Saturday, underlining Beijing’s efforts to deepen cooperation with Pyongyang, which has drawn closer to Russia.】

item.title: 1500 亿美元的财富在关键时刻为卡塔尔王室提供了支持
item.description:
阿勒萨尼家族的财富将随着该国天然气生产的扩大而膨胀，使其免受世界杯的影响。【原文：

The Al Thani family’s fortune is poised to swell alongside the expansion of the country’s natural gas production, cushioning it from a World Cup hangover.

】

item.title: 萨默斯警告避免货币政策出现 "严重错误
item.description:
他说，通胀数据显示美联储应维持利率不变

。【原文：

Inflation data show the Fed should leave rates where they are, he says

】

item.title: 伊朗在霍尔木兹海峡附近扣押与以色列有关的集装箱船
item.description: 据国营伊斯兰共和国通讯社报道，伊朗伊斯兰革命卫队周六在波斯湾和阿曼湾之间的霍尔木兹海峡附近扣押了一艘与以色列有联系的集装箱船。【原文：Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps seized an Israel-linked container ship near the Strait of Hormuz between the Persian Gulf and Gulf of Oman on Saturday, the state-run Islamic Republic News Agency reported.】

item.title: 印度启动紧急规则让天然气发电厂夏季运行
item.description: 随着电力需求开始上升，印度援引了一项紧急条款，命令其闲置的燃气发电站在夏季运行。【原文：India has invoked an emergency provision to order its idling gas-fired power stations to operate during the summer, as electricity demand starts to rise.】

item.title: 乌克兰称东部局势恶化，俄罗斯加紧攻击
item.description: 乌克兰总司令表示，乌克兰东部的局势 "严重恶化"，俄罗斯军队在温暖干燥的天气里加强了攻击。【原文：The situation in Ukraine’s east has “worsened significantly,” with Russian troops stepping up attacks during a spell of warm and dry weather, according to Ukraine’s commander-in-chief.】

item.title: 英国军方警告霍尔木兹海峡附近可能有船只被拦截
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国迪拜（美联社）— 美联社看到的一段视频显示，突击队周六在霍尔木兹海峡附近用直升机袭击了一艘船，在德黑兰与西方国家关系更加紧张的背景下，一名中东国防官员认为这次袭击是伊朗所为。【原文：DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A video seen by The Associated Press shows commandos raiding a ship near the Strait of Hormuz by helicopter Saturday, an attack a Mideast defense official attributed to Iran amid wider tensions between Tehran and the West.】

item.title: 地中海航运公司称巴尔的摩灾难中的托运人面临 "普遍平均值
item.description: 据世界领先的集装箱承运商称，摧毁巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的船只的船东已经启动了一个正式程序，拥有 "达利号 "上货物的公司将不得不分担部分经济损失。【原文：The owner of the ship that destroyed Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge has started a formal process in which companies that own goods on the stricken Dali will have to share some of the financial losses, according to the world’s leading container carrier.】

item.title: 乌克兰战争进入新阶段，能源问题成焦点
item.description:
随着俄罗斯和乌克兰对石油、天然气和电力设施的打击，附带损害正在全球市场上显现。【原文：

As Russia and Ukraine trade blows against oil, gas and power facilities, the collateral damage is showing up in global markets.

】

item.title: Blackstone 牵头为数据中心公司提供 20 亿美元私人贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 牵头为 Park Place Technologies 提供了约 20 亿美元的一揽子融资计划，以对该公司的债务进行再融资，并为其私募股权所有者的偿付提供资金。【原文：Blackstone Inc. led a roughly $2 billion financing package to Park Place Technologies to refinance the company’s debt and to fund a payout to its private equity owners, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 伊朗如何通过结盟武装组织扩张势力
item.description: 4 月 1 日，伊朗在叙利亚首都大马士革的外交大楼遭到空袭，以色列正准备进行报复：伊朗可能直接攻击以色列，也可能通过其数十年来支持和扶植的外国民兵同盟网络进行报复。自 10 月份以色列与伊朗支持的巴勒斯坦组织哈马斯开战以来，这些民兵加强了针对以色列的行动。【原文：As Israel braces for retaliation for an April 1 airstrike on Iran’s diplomatic buildings in the Syrian capital, Damascus, intelligence officials posed two possibilities: Iran might attack Israel directly, or it could lash out through the network of allied foreign militias it has supported and nurtured for decades. In either case, the militias, which have stepped up actions against Israel since the start of its war with the Iran-backed Palestinian group Hamas in October, would be likely to escala】

item.title: 英国首相表示已准备好 "减税并为增长下注
item.description: 在英国二月份国内生产总值（GDP）再次增长之后，英国财政大臣杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）宣布，他已经准备好 "减税并为增长下注"。【原文：Chancellor Jeremy Hunt has declared he is ready to "cut taxes and bet on growth" after the UK's gross domestic product (GDP) grew again in February.】

item.title: 澳洲航空改道澳大利亚-伦敦航班以避开伊朗领空
item.description: 由于担心伊朗正计划对以色列发动迫在眉睫的袭击，澳洲航空公司（Qantas Airways Ltd.）暂时改变了从珀斯直飞伦敦的航线，以避开中东地区的空域。【原文：Qantas Airways Ltd. has temporarily rerouted its direct service from Perth to London as it seeks to avoid airspace in the Middle East amid fears that Iran is planning an imminent attack on Israel.】
